contextId.occurrenceNote: The second phrase builds on the first. They make the same point. "By the puff of God's breath they die, the rushing wind of his anger devastates them." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: perish ... are consumed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be put into active form. Alternate translation: "something breaks them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are broken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "something scatters the cubs of the lioness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the cubs of the lioness are scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may also be put into active form. Alternate translation: "they die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Can you eat that which has no taste" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Can that which has no taste be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: "my success has been taken from me." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my wisdom is gone" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: wisdom has been driven out of me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A friend should be faithful to the person who feels he is about to faint" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: To the person who is about to faint, faithfulness should be shown by his friend

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but they were disappointed" or "but they were not satisfied" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but they were deceived

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "so I endure months of misery; I get trouble-filled nights" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I have been made to endure months of misery; I have been given trouble-filled nights

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "As a cloud fades" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: As a cloud is consumed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if someone pulls him out of his place" or "if a gardener tears him out of the garden" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if this person is destroyed out of his place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gives the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The earth is given

contextId.occurrenceNote: "I will be accused and punished." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will condemn me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be condemned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can rebuild it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it cannot be built again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if you were to prove me wrong" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if I were proved wrong

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "You determine a man's days" or "You decide how long a man lives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Man's days are determined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "rocks tumble down from their place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: rocks are moved out of their place

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Did God bring you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Were you brought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to whom alone God gave the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to whom alone the land was given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all the years that God has laid up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the number of years that are laid up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "should everyone leave the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: should the earth be forsaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The word "rocks" here refers to large rocks, such as those in the mountains. Alternate translation: "should God remove the rocks from their places" or "should God move mountains around" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: should the rocks be removed out of their places

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will go out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be put out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone has hidden a noose on the ground in order to catch him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A noose is hidden for him on the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Also, this speaks of a disease destroying his body as if it were an animal that had attacked him and was eating him. Alternate translation: "Disease will eat away at his skin" or "Disease will destroy his skin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: The parts of his body will be devoured

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Disaster rips him out of his tent, where he is safe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He is torn from the safety of his tent

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it marches him off" or "it forces him to go" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: marched off

contextId.occurrenceNote: People used sulfur to get rid of any diseases from a dying person. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after they spread sulfur all over his home" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after they see that sulfur is scattered within his home

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his branches will wither" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will his branch be cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will drive the wicked person from light into darkness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He will be driven from light into darkness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will chase him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be chased out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my acquaintances have alienated themselves from me" or "my friends treat me like a stranger" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: my acquaintances are wholly alienated from me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will find him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will not be found

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God keeps the wicked man from the day of calamity ... God leads him away from the day of wrath" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the wicked man is kept from the day of calamity ... he is led away from the day of wrath

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will carry him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be borne

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "those who rose up" refers to the wicked people. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Surely God has destroyed the wicked people who harmed us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Surely those who rose up against us are cut off

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will cause you to succeed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be confirmed for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my judge would acquit me forever" or "God, who is my judge, would say that I am innocent once and for all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I would be acquitted forever by my judge

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God curses the part of the land that they own" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their portion of the land is cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will remember him anymore" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be remembered no more

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will bring them low" or "God will destroy them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be brought low

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. What "the others" refers to can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "God will gather them up as he gathered up the other wicked people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: they will be gathered up like all the others

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated actively. The word "them" refers to the waters. Alternate translation: "but the weight of the waters does not tear the clouds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but the clouds are not torn under them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People take iron out of the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Iron is taken out of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people smelt copper out of the stone" or "people heat stone to melt copper out of it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: copper is smelted out of the stone

contextId.occurrenceNote: "and it is not found in the land of the living." The "land of the living" refers to this world where people live. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and no one can find wisdom in this world" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: neither is it found in the land of the living

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the birds are unable to see wisdom. This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "even the birds that fly in the skies cannot see wisdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is kept hidden from the birds of the heavens

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The noblemen hushed their voices" or "The noblemen stopped speaking" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The voices of the noblemen were hushed

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "were driven out" means "were forced to leave." These phrases can be reordered and stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people shouted after them as ... a thief and forced them to leave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were driven out from among people who shouted after them as ... a thief

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "let someone else come and take the harvest from my field" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let my crops be uprooted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it would be a crime for which judges would be right to punish me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it would be a crime to be punished by judges

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "then let someone tear off my shoulder from the shoulder blade and break my arm from its joint" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder blade, and let my arm be broken from its joint

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for which judges would be right to punish me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be punished by judges

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I may feel better" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I may be refreshed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has also made me" or "God has formed both of us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I also have been formed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God also punishes a person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Man is punished also

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "His flesh" refers to his fat and muscles, not to his body's outer skin. Alternate translation: "Disease makes his body weak and thin so that a person can see his bones" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: His flesh is consumed away so that it cannot be seen; his bones, once not seen, now stick out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but God did not punish me for sinning" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but my sin was not punished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an idiom and may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he may be happy to still be alive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: he may be enlightened with the light of life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God considers me to be a liar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am considered to be a liar

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The phrase "will be shaken" is an idiom that means to be "struck." Alternate translation: "God strikes them and they die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: people will be shaken and will pass away

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and destroys them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If only we could put Job on trial in" or "If only we could take Job to court so a judge could listen to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If only Job were put on trial in

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "they" refers righteous people whom God will discipline if they sin. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If someone binds them in chains" or "If someone makes them a prisoner" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If they are bound in chains

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your servants would set your table" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your table would be set

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God is testing you by making you suffer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you are being tested by suffering

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when people hear his voice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when his voice is heard

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Should I have someone tell him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Should he be told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The morning takes away the 'light' of wicked people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: From wicked people their 'light' is taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: These can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "What is the path to where I distribute the lightning bolts or to where I scatter the winds from the east over the earth?" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: What is the path to where the lightning bolts are distributed or to where the winds are scattered from the east over the earth?

contextId.occurrenceNote: The rain makes the loose dry dirt stick together like one piece of dirt. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the rain molds the dirt into a hard mass" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when the dust runs into a hard mass

contextId.occurrenceNote: This generalization can be translated as a statement in active form. Alternate translation: "Anyone who looks at him will be so frightened that he will throw himself on the ground." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: will not anyone be thrown down to the ground just by the sight of him?

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can pull them apart" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they cannot be pulled apart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can move them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they cannot be moved

contextId.occurrenceNote: A club made of straw would not hurt him, and a club made of wood would not hurt him. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "He thinks of clubs as if they were straw" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Clubs are regarded as straw

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one can stop any of your plans" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no purpose of yours can be stopped
